verses.kjv: Then all the captains of the forces, and Johanan the son of Kareah, and Jezaniah the son of Hoshaiah, and all the people from the least even unto the greatest, came near,
verses.web: Then all the captains of the forces, and Johanan the son of Kareah, and Jezaniah the son of Hoshaiah, and all the people from the least even to the greatest, came near,
verses.ct: Then all the military commanders, including Johanan son of Kareah and Jezaniah son of Hoshaiah, along with everyone from the least important to the most important, came to Jeremiah.

verses.kjv: And said unto Jeremiah the prophet, Let, we beseech thee, our supplication be accepted before thee, and pray for us unto the LORD thy God, even for all this remnant; (for we are left but a few of many, as thine eyes do behold us:)
verses.web: and said to Jeremiah the prophet, “Please let our supplication be presented before you, and pray for us to LORD your God, even for all this remnant; for we are left but a few of many, as your eyes see us;
verses.ct: They said to Jeremiah the prophet, "Please hear our plea. Pray to the LORD your God for us — for all of us who are left. As you can see with your own eyes, only a few of us remain out of what was once a great number.

verses.kjv: That the LORD thy God may shew us the way wherein we may walk, and the thing that we may do.
verses.web: that LORD your God may show us the way in which we should walk, and the things that we should do.”
verses.ct: Ask the LORD your God to show us which way we should go and what we should do."

verses.kjv: Then Jeremiah the prophet said unto them, I have heard you; behold, I will pray unto the LORD your God according to your words; and it shall come to pass, that whatsoever thing the LORD shall answer you, I will declare it unto you; I will keep nothing back from you.
verses.web: Then Jeremiah the prophet said to them, “I have heard you. Behold, I will pray to LORD your God according to your words; and it will happen that whatever thing LORD answers you, I will declare it to you. I will keep nothing back from you.”
verses.ct: Jeremiah the prophet answered them, "I hear you. I will pray to the LORD your God just as you've asked, and whatever the LORD tells me, I'll pass it on to you — every word, holding nothing back."

verses.kjv: Then they said to Jeremiah, The LORD be a true and faithful witness between us, if we do not even according to all things for the which the LORD thy God shall send thee to us.
verses.web: Then they said to Jeremiah, “May LORD be a true and faithful witness among us, if we don’t do according to all the word with which LORD your God sends you to tell us.
verses.ct: They replied, "May the LORD be a true and faithful witness against us if we don't follow every instruction the LORD your God gives you for us.

verses.kjv: Whether it be good, or whether it be evil, we will obey the voice of the LORD our God, to whom we send thee; that it may be well with us, when we obey the voice of the LORD our God.
verses.web: Whether it is good, or whether it is bad, we will obey the voice of LORD our God, to whom we send you; that it may be well with us, when we obey the voice of LORD our God.”
verses.ct: Whether the answer is something we want to hear or something we don't, we will obey the LORD our God, the one we're sending you to ask. Things will go well for us when we obey the LORD our God."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass after ten days, that the word of the LORD came unto Jeremiah.
verses.web: After ten days, LORD’s word came to Jeremiah.
verses.ct: 10 days later, the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah.

verses.kjv: Then called he Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces which were with him, and all the people from the least even to the greatest,
verses.web: Then he called Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces who were with him, and all the people from the least even to the greatest,
verses.ct: So he called together Johanan son of Kareah, all the military commanders who were with him, and all the people from the least important to the most important.

verses.kjv: And said unto them, Thus saith the LORD, the God of Israel, unto whom ye sent me to present your supplication before him;
verses.web: and said to them, “LORD, the God of Israel, to whom you sent me to present your supplication before him, says:
verses.ct: He told them, "This is what the LORD, the God of Israel — the one you sent me to bring your plea before — has to say:

verses.kjv: If ye will still abide in this land, then will I build you, and not pull you down, and I will plant you, and not pluck you up: for I repent me of the evil that I have done unto you.
verses.web: ‘If you will still live in this land, then I will build you, and not pull you down, and I will plant you, and not pluck you up; for I grieve over the distress that I have brought on you.
verses.ct: 'If you stay in this land, I will build you up and not tear you down. I will plant you and not uproot you, because I grieve over the disaster I brought on you.

verses.kjv: Be not afraid of the king of Babylon, of whom ye are afraid; be not afraid of him, saith the LORD: for I am with you to save you, and to deliver you from his hand.
verses.web: Don’t be afraid of the king of Babylon, of whom you are afraid. Don’t be afraid of him,’ says LORD: ‘for I am with you to save you, and to deliver you from his hand.
verses.ct: Don't be afraid of the king of Babylon — the one you're so terrified of. Don't fear him,' declares the LORD, 'because I am with you. I will save you and rescue you from his power.

verses.kjv: And I will shew mercies unto you, that he may have mercy upon you, and cause you to return to your own land.
verses.web: I will grant you mercy, that he may have mercy on you, and cause you to return to your own land.
verses.ct: I will show you mercy so that he too will have mercy on you and let you return to your own land.'

verses.kjv: But if ye say, We will not dwell in this land, neither obey the voice of the LORD your God,
verses.web: “ ‘But if you say, “We will not dwell in this land;” so that you don’t obey LORD your God’s voice,
verses.ct: "But if you say, 'We refuse to stay in this land,' and you disobey the LORD your God,

verses.kjv: Saying, No; but we will go into the land of Egypt, where we shall see no war, nor hear the sound of the trumpet, nor have hunger of bread; and there will we dwell:
verses.web: saying, “No; but we will go into the land of Egypt, where we will see no war, nor hear the sound of the trumpet, nor have hunger of bread; and there will we dwell:” ’
verses.ct: saying, 'No — we're going to Egypt, where we won't see any war, won't hear any battle trumpets, and won't go hungry. That's where we'll settle' —

verses.kjv: And now therefore hear the word of the LORD, ye remnant of Judah; Thus saith the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel; If ye wholly set your faces to enter into Egypt, and go to sojourn there;
verses.web: now therefore hear LORD’s word, O remnant of Judah: LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, says, ‘If you indeed set your faces to enter into Egypt, and go to live there;
verses.ct: then listen to the word of the LORD, you remnant of Judah. The LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: 'If you are determined to go to Egypt and settle there,

verses.kjv: Then it shall come to pass, that the sword, which ye feared, shall overtake you there in the land of Egypt, and the famine, whereof ye were afraid, shall follow close after you there in Egypt; and there ye shall die.
verses.web: then it will happen that the sword, which you fear, will overtake you there in the land of Egypt; and the famine, about which you are afraid, will follow close behind you there in Egypt; and you will die there.
verses.ct: then the very sword you're afraid of will catch up with you there in Egypt. The very famine you dread will follow you there. And you will die in Egypt.

verses.kjv: So shall it be with all the men that set their faces to go into Egypt to sojourn there; they shall die by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence: and none of them shall remain or escape from the evil that I will bring upon them.
verses.web: So will it be with all the men who set their faces to go into Egypt to live there. They will die by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence. None of them will remain or escape from the evil that I will bring on them.’
verses.ct: Everyone who is determined to go live in Egypt will die by the sword, by famine, and by disease. Not a single one of them will survive or escape the disaster I will bring on them.'

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel; As mine anger and my fury hath been poured forth upon the inhabitants of Jerusalem; so shall my fury be poured forth upon you, when ye shall enter into Egypt: and ye shall be an execration, and an astonishment, and a curse, and a reproach; and ye shall see this place no more.
verses.web: For LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, says: ‘As my anger and my wrath has been poured out on the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so my wrath will be poured out on you, when you enter into Egypt; and you will be an object of horror, an astonishment, a curse, and a reproach; and you will see this place no more.’
verses.ct: "The LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: 'Just as my anger and fury were poured out on the people of Jerusalem, so my fury will be poured out on you when you enter Egypt. You will become an object of horror, a curse word, and a disgrace. And you will never see this land again.'

verses.kjv: The LORD hath said concerning you, O ye remnant of Judah; Go ye not into Egypt: know certainly that I have admonished you this day.
verses.web: “LORD has spoken concerning you, remnant of Judah, ‘Don’t go into Egypt!’ Know certainly that I have testified to you today.
verses.ct: "The LORD has spoken to you, remnant of Judah: 'Do not go to Egypt!' Understand this clearly — I am warning you today.

verses.kjv: For ye dissembled in your hearts, when ye sent me unto the LORD your God, saying, Pray for us unto the LORD our God; and according unto all that the LORD our God shall say, so declare unto us, and we will do it.
verses.web: For you have dealt deceitfully against your own souls; for you sent me to LORD your God, saying, ‘Pray for us to LORD our God; and according to all that LORD our God says, so declare to us, and we will do it.’
verses.ct: You were deceiving yourselves when you sent me to the LORD your God, saying, 'Pray to the LORD our God for us, and whatever the LORD our God says, tell us and we'll do it.'

verses.kjv: And now I have this day declared it to you; but ye have not obeyed the voice of the LORD your God, nor any thing for the which he hath sent me unto you.
verses.web: I have declared it to you today; but you have not obeyed LORD your God’s voice in anything for which he has sent me to you.
verses.ct: Well, today I've told you exactly what he said — and you have not obeyed the LORD your God in anything he sent me to tell you.

verses.kjv: Now therefore know certainly that ye shall die by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence, in the place whither ye desire to go and to sojourn.
verses.web: Now therefore know certainly that you will die by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence in the place where you desire to go to live there.”
verses.ct: So understand this clearly: you will die by the sword, by famine, and by disease in the very place where you want to go and settle."
